name: Elephant and Jeep Safari at Kaziranga National Park
description:
Sprawling over an area of 430 sq km, Kaziranga National Park is the only natural home to the imposing one-horned Rhinos in the world. On a whole, two-third of the total number of one-horned Rhinos is found in this national park. Located between the suburbs of Golaghat and Nagaon districts, Assam, the park also has a significant number of Elephants, Indian Tigers and Asiatic Buffalos. It is due to the indigenous wildlife of Kaziranga, this park has been declared as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1985. 

The park is well connected to the nearby regions and can be easily reached from Guwahati, the capital-city of Assam and other parts of Assam. A complete reflection of lush and verdant forests and grasslands, the park comprises mainly of elephant grass, moist forests and swamp areas. Elephant Safari and Jeep Safari are the best ways to explore and unfold the vigour and splendour of this sanctuary.
